column4: Just updated a 10.04 headless lamp server to 12.04. Its an old machine running a 32bit cpu with pae for memory. Was wondering why the kernel was only bumped up to hyperspace 3.0.0-20-generic-pae and not 3.2.0 ?
sry hyperspace is the name of the machine.
I tried a dist-upgrade but nothing =/
Is there a 32bit kernel for pae that is 3.2.0 ?
does apt-get say anything about it?
yeah I was just about to take a look at that.
what is your kernel name uname -a
Linux buttface 3.2.0-24-generic-pae #37-Ubuntu SMP Wed Apr 25 10:47:59 UTC 2012 i686 athlon i386 GNU/Linux
I am only seesing this  sudo apt-cache search linux-image-3.2.0-24-generic-pae
linux-image-3.2.0-24-generic-pae - Linux kernel image for version 3.2.0 on 64 bit x86 SMP
genii-around so I should just install it?
